messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Not having a backbone
messages.msgSnippet: My oldest is only three so people don t usually question anything I m doing.. because with her being so young- nothing I m doing seems out of the norm to them
messages.messageBody:
My oldest is only three so people don't usually question anything I'm doing.. because with her being so young- nothing I'm doing seems out of the norm to them I suppose.


frozenandcold <fivefreebirds@...> wrote:
<<<<I just dont have the backbones some people do, so I just got
offended and started weaning her because I was afraid of what other
people would think and may start teasing my daughter or what have
you.

At four and half years old, is it hard still breastfeeding him?
People can be very rude at times and I just don't know that I could
deal with it.
>>>>>>>

I'm taken back that this is coming from an unschooler! Unschooling
isn't exactly mainstream either. How do you handle people who
disagree with your choice to unschool?

Heidi






*Kristen*
Kendall MacKenzie
8/30/2003
Riley Elizabeth
11/7/2005
Nolan Alexander
9/20/2006
